intro: Chaetanthera delicatula, commonly known as the slender moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom at night. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
